intro: Lasiocephalus ovatus, commonly known as the woolly-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant features dense, woolly hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it a soft, fuzzy appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
